Welcome to pyCrunchCron’s documentation!¶

Contents:

pyCrunchCron.py¶

Crunch a set of Cronometer files.

Background¶

Cronometer is a diet tracker. Cronometer dumps out data as a .csv (EXCEL) file. This program takes the output file from Cronometer and creates a reduced data set.

Usage¶

This program prompts for macros and biometrics files. The output file is created in the same path with as CronCrunch-YY-MM-DD.csv

API¶

class pyCrunchCron.ControlClass¶
combineDataLists(servingsList, weightBiometricList)¶
Parameters:
  • outFilePtr – Points to the output file.
  • servingsList – The servings list.
  • servingsList – The biometrics list.
crunchServingsList(servingsList)¶
Parameters:servingsList – The servings list.
Returns:list of [‘Date’,’Protein’,’Fat’,’Carbs’]

Take the foods and sum up the Protein, Fat and Carbs for each food item.

crunchWeightList(weightBiometricList)¶
Parameters:weightBiometricList – The biometrics list.
Returns:[‘Date’,’Protein(g)’,’Fat(g)’,’Carbs(g)’,’Weight(lbs)’]

12/14/2017,Weight (Nokia),lbs,183.731 12/14/2017,Body Fat (Nokia),%,19.751 1/4/2018,Blood Glucose,mg/dL,99 5/13/2018,Ketones (Breath),ppm,4.1

theExecutive()¶
Global lastPathFileName:
 The path and file name that was found by the browser.

The code that calls the other code. This code uses the defaults library to handle the default path. This code uses the read CSV library to read in the CSV file.
